metadata.title: CVE-2014-4678 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: The safe_eval function in Ansible before 1.6.4 does not properly restrict the code subset, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted instructions. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4657. It was discovered that Ansible mishandled certain input. A remote attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code.

notes.note: seth-arnold> This CVE was the result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-4657

criterions.comment: ansible package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.6+dfsg-1').
